channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Salmonella outbreak linked to California egg distributor sickens 79 people
item.description: U.S. health officials confirmed the salmonella infections were linked to contaminated organic and cage-free brown eggs from August Egg Company. All recalled eggs should be thrown away, the CDC said.
item.content:encoded: U.S. health officials confirmed the salmonella infections were linked to contaminated organic and cage-free brown eggs from August Egg Company. All recalled eggs should be thrown away, the CDC said.
item.dc:creator: Clare Marie Schneider

item.title: Vance voices loyalty to Trump but says he 'understands' Musk's frustration
item.description: As the Trump-Musk feud escalated, JD Vance signaled loyalty to Trump during a recent podcast appearance. At the same time, the vice president said he understands Musk's frustration.
item.content:encoded:
As the Trump-Musk feud escalated, JD Vance signaled loyalty to Trump during a recent podcast appearance. At the same time, the vice president said he understands Musk's frustration.

(Image credit: Bloomberg)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: 78th Tony Awards preview: What to expect on Broadway's biggest night
item.description: 78th Tony Awards preview: What to expect on Broadway's biggest night
item.content:encoded: 78th Tony Awards preview: What to expect on Broadway's biggest night
item.dc:creator: Jeff Lunden

item.title: Coco Gauff wins the French Open to claim her 2nd Grand Slam title
item.description: The 21-year-old American star battled back over three sets to defeat the world's top-ranked player, Aryna Sabalenka. Gauff is the first American to win at Roland-Garros since Serena Williams in 2015.
item.content:encoded:
The 21-year-old American star battled back over three sets to defeat the world's top-ranked player, Aryna Sabalenka. Gauff is the first American to win at Roland-Garros since Serena Williams in 2015.

(Image credit: Thibuad Moritz)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: Israel says it has retrieved the body of a Thai hostage in Gaza
item.description: Israel said it had retrieved the body of Nattapong Pinta, who was abducted during the Oct. 7, 2023, attack that sparked the war. He had come to Israel to work in agriculture.
item.content:encoded:
Israel said it had retrieved the body of Nattapong Pinta, who was abducted during the Oct. 7, 2023, attack that sparked the war. He had come to Israel to work in agriculture.

(Image credit: Hostage's Family Forum)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A former police chief who escaped from an Arkansas prison is captured
item.description: A former police chief and convicted killer known as the "Devil in the Ozarks" was captured by law enforcement 1.5 miles from the prison he escaped from following a nearly two-week-long manhunt.
item.content:encoded:
A former police chief and convicted killer known as the "Devil in the Ozarks" was captured by law enforcement 1.5 miles from the prison he escaped from following a nearly two-week-long manhunt.

(Image credit: Arkansas Department of Corrections)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The many ways Ukraine carries out unprecedented drone attacks
item.description: With one surprise attack after another, Ukraine keeps inventing new ways to wage war with drones. In turn, Russia is building a massive drone army of its own.
item.content:encoded:
With one surprise attack after another, Ukraine keeps inventing new ways to wage war with drones. In turn, Russia is building a massive drone army of its own.

(Image credit: Genya Savilov)
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: Should federal rental aid come with a time limit? Here's how it works in one place
item.description: The Trump administration wants to allow a cutoff date for housing subsidies. The plan is deeply controversial, but Delaware offers a potential model for success.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration wants to allow a cutoff date for housing subsidies. The plan is deeply controversial, but Delaware offers a potential model for success.

(Image credit: Wesley LaPointe)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: 4 takeaways from Erin Patterson's testimony at her toxic mushroom triple murder trial
item.description: Patterson is accused of putting death cap mushrooms in a meal she served her estranged husband's relatives in July 2023, killing three. She took the stand in Week 6 of the trial gripping Australia.
item.content:encoded:
Patterson is accused of putting death cap mushrooms in a meal she served her estranged husband's relatives in July 2023, killing three. She took the stand in Week 6 of the trial gripping Australia.

(Image credit: Jason Edwards)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Torture and treason trials: what's happening in Tanzania?
item.description: Tanzania's government is facing growing accusations of repression after prominent human rights defenders say they were beaten and sexually assaulted while in custody.
item.content:encoded:
Tanzania's government is facing growing accusations of repression after prominent human rights defenders say they were beaten and sexually assaulted while in custody.

(Image credit: Tony Karumba)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett
